intro: Mabea pohliana, commonly known as the yellow mabea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy yellow flowers and palmate leaves, which are often used in traditional medicine. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is sometimes cultivated for ornamental purposes. Due to habitat loss, it is considered threatened in some areas.
